newsitem.title: USA: U.S. factory lard use - Census.
newsitem.headline: U.S. factory lard use - Census.

text.p: U.S. factories used 32.0 million lbs of lard in edible and inedible product output in August 1996 versus a revised 32.5 million lbs in July and 35.9 million lbs in August 1995 the Census Bureau said.
Usage so far in the 1996 period amounted to 281.3 million lbs versus 307.1 million lbs in the 1995 period.
Usage includes hydrogenated vegetable and animal fats and other fats and oils in process.
